project-description_metagenome_name: Luquillo Experimental Forest Soil, Puerto Rico Metagenome
sample-isolation-and-treatment_sample_is: Soils were collected from the Bisley watershed ∼250 meters above sea level (masl) from the 0-10 cm depth, using a 2.5-cm diameter soil corer. Cores were stored intact in Ziploc bags at ambient temperature and immediately transported to the lab, where they were used for growth inocula or frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at −80°C for molecular analysis. DNA was extracted using a modified CTAB extraction method with bead beating and phenol-chloro- form extraction, with the following exceptions: phosphate buffer concentration was 250 mM; 50 μL 100 mM aluminum ammonium sulfate (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO) was added to the soils as a flocculant for excess humics.
sample-isolation-and-treatment_sample_si: however much fits in 2.5 cm diameter soil corer
sample-origin_location: subtropical lower montane wet forest in the Luquillo Experimental Forest
sequences_sequences_filtered: Obtained sequencing reads were quality trimmed using the software tool lucy to an accuracy of 99.3%.
soil_cur_vegetation: Dacryodes excelsa, early sucessional trees, herbs, and tree ferns
